message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL 

This paper proposes a novel end-to-end trainable network for text detection and recognition, which involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as instance segmentation and attention models. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also leverages existing OCR engines, which involves artificial intelligence (AI) techniques. Hence, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also likely. The proposed method involves training a neural network, which falls under the sub-category of machine learning (ML). Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques such as text recognition. Hence, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as attention models for decoding textual content. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is another possible sub-category.
